column4: This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source
try sudo apt-get install linux-headers-generic , that should pull the right headers as dependency.
it might be that your sources.list is screwed. get afresh one at !easysource then , and sudo apt.get update afterwards
than it says: linux-headers-generic is already the newest version. ... I mean the headers are present in the directory of my old kernel, but in the new one they are not
look in /usr/src . is there a linux-headers-2.6.20-16 dir ?
: no, just two for the previous kernel (normal / generic )

think twice if you really want to upgrade. I'm quite suspicious you broke your conf already by use of automatix or some other 'helper'-script, so you have a pretty high chance to hose your install in the process. And IMHO gutsy is quite pointless for the majority of users
the only thing is that i included some source repos
but  didnt use automatix or something like
so did you regenerate your sources.list and apt-get update 'd ?
but take my word. you're going to regret the upgrade, so make a backup first
lsb_release says anyway that I am already gutsy
huh ?
is my kernel 2.6.20-16-generic the current kernel for gutsy?
no, that's the feisty kernel. and using the feisty kernel with gutsy results in quite a couple of issues
so how could this happen and how can I fix it?

i don't know what you did, so i can't tell what happened. My suggestion would be to make a backup and do clean reinstall of feisty (prolly a netinstall with the minimal .iso), so you don't need to upgrade after install, but have immediatly all the latest (feisty-)packages installed

what I did is installing via USB stick and netinstall, because my laptop hasn't got a CDROM. After that I updated because of the more comfortable Bluetooth support. I didn't find an option to install gutsy directly with the netinstall
is it possible to upgrade the kernel on it's own?
so you did a gutsy netinstall with a feisty installer... hmmm, i wonder that it worked at all. Man, don't screw around with that unclean state. Start over with a clean gutsy installation medium

i did a feity install with a feisty installer (netinstall) and upgraded to gutsy. So usally it should work... Where can I find the gutsy netisntaller? on the .ISO? Because I have to build a bootable USB key 'cause I dont have a CDROM...
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation has some tricks for you
